description: information about works of classical literature

command.prompt:
Generate 3 new attributes for a table of information about works of classical literature. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes to not generate is:
Characters;Locations;Author;Title;Year;Rating;Style;Genre;Poem;Element;Length;Theme

Generate real attributes. Do not generate fictional ones. Here are the semi-colon-separated rows of the table by semantic key only:
Author;Title
Austen;Pride and Prejudice
Dickens;Great Expectations
Garcia-Marquez;One Hundred Years of Solitude
Hardy;Tess of the d'Urbervilles
Herrick;To the Virgins
Homer;The Iliad
Joyce;Ulysses
Plath;Ariel
Shakespeare;As You Like It
Shelley;Ozymandias
Vonnegut;Slaughterhouse-Five

Generate values of real data for all existing rows of the table. Generate and output a new table, include the table header, with only the attributes Author, Title, and the new attributes in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Author;Title;Original Language;Initial Publication Language
Austen;Pride and Prejudice;English;English
Dickens;Great Expectations;English;English
Garcia-Marquez;One Hundred Years of Solitude;Spanish;Spanish
Hardy;Tess of the d'Urbervilles;English;English
Herrick;To the Virgins;English;English
Homer;The Iliad;Ancient Greek;Ancient Greek
Joyce;Ulysses;English;English
Plath;Ariel;English;English
Shakespeare;As You Like It;English;Early Modern English
Shelley;Ozymandias;English;English
Vonnegut;Slaughterhouse-Five;English;English
command.epilogue:
The new attributes are "Original Language" and "Initial Publication Language". "Original Language" refers to the language in which the work was first written. For most of these works, this will be the same as the "Initial Publication Language", which is the language in which the work was first published. However, some works have been translated from their original language, so for those works, "Original Language" and "Initial Publication Language" may be different.

"Original Language" for these works is as follows:
Austen's "Pride and Prejudice" was originally written in English.
Dickens' "Great Expectations" was originally written in English.
Garcia-Marquez's "One Hundred Years of Solitude" was originally written in Spanish.
Hardy's "Tess of the d'Urbervilles" was originally written in English.
Herrick's "To the Virgins" was originally written in English.
Homer's "The Iliad" was originally written in Ancient Greek.
Joyce's "Ulysses" was originally written in English.
Plath's "Ariel" was originally written in English.
Shakespeare's "As You Like It" was originally written in Early Modern English.
Shelley's "Ozymandias" was originally written in English.
Vonnegut's "Slaughterhouse-Five" was originally written in English.

"Initial Publication Language" for these works is as follows:
Austen's "Pride and Prejudice" was first published in English.
Dickens' "Great Expectations" was first published in English.
Garcia-Marquez's "One Hundred Years of Solitude" was first published in Spanish.
Hardy's "Tess of the d'Urbervilles" was first published in English.
Herrick's "To the Virgins" was first published in English.
Homer's "The Iliad" was first published in Ancient Greek.
Joyce's "Ulysses" was first published in English.
Plath's "Ariel" was first published in English.
Shakespeare's "As You Like It" was first published in Early Modern English.
Shelley's "Ozymandias" was first published in English.
Vonnegut's "Slaughterhouse-Five" was first published in English.
